errrorrr: The JACK sound server needs to be running in order to run IDJC. In order to manually start it try something like: $ jackd -d alsa -r 44100 -p 2048 If you would like JACK to start automatically with your user specified parameters try something like this, which will create a file called .jackdrc in your home directory:  $ echo "/usr/bin/jackd -d alsa -r 44100" > ~/.jackdrc If you have already done this it is possible another application or non-JACK sound ser
ver is using the sound card. Possible remedies would be to close the other audio app or configure the sound server to go into suspend mode after a brief amount of idle time.

if you are trying to connect to a named jack server, either set the environment variable JACK_DEFAULT_SERVER to that name or launch IDJC with the -j jackservername option. For example:   $ jackd -n xyzzy -d alsa -r 44100 -p 2048 &   $ idjc -p profilename -j xyzzy
Could not connect to JACK server as client.
Please check the messages window for more info.
start jackd on a terminal before starting the application
if it's not installed: sudo apt-get install jackd
then just run it, and then start idjc
